intro: Cirrhopetalum japonicum, commonly known as the Japanese bellflower, is a flowering plant native to Japan. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, white or pale blue flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and mountainous regions. Its leaves are lance-shaped and arranged alternately along the stem. The flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, attracting pollinators like bees and butterflies.
